results.title: Greystoke: The Legend of Tarzan, lord of the apes
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Hugh Hudson and Stanley S. Canter
results.brief_description: A lavish re-telling of the Tarzan legend which stays remarkably faithful to the original Edgar Rice Burroughs’ story. The film recounts the circumstances which led to the child Earl of Greystoke being raised by a family of apes until he is discovered by a Belgian explorer, who teaches him human language, and takes him back to the aristocratic Greystoke manor in Britain. There Tarzan must deal with the cruelty of human snobbery and hypocrisy. Christopher Lambert is Tarzan, Andie MacDowell is a pure-hearted Jane. Also starring Ralph Richardson, Ian Holm, and James Fox. Partly filmed on location in Cameroon.

results.title: Greyn - "Beckher"
results.brief_description:
This experimental music video was developed for Melbourne art-rock band, Greyn, with the assistance of the Australian Council for the Arts. A non-commercial film, it breaks down the generic film conventions of commercial music video production by not promoting the band as sexy, as rock gods, or as exceptional musicians, but by telling the story of inner balance.
The two performers, Sangeetha Jane and Daimon Barry, move through an experimental yoga/dance sequence that sees them grow and evolve over the course of a hauntingly beautiful track entitled “Beckher”.
(No title or credits)

results.title: Greyfriars Bobby: the true story of a dog
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Don Chaffey
results.brief_description: Based on the children’s book by Eleanor Atkinson, this delightful movie tells the story of a lovable and faithful terrier named Bobby. Bobby is owned by the family at Cauldbrae Farm, but he chooses his own master in “Old Jock”(Alex Mackenzie), caretaker at the farm. When Jock dies, Bobby remains steadfast in his refusal to leave his master’s gravesite at the estate where he worked. The new caretaker of the farm, James Brown (Donald Crisp), is not keen about having Bobby forced on him but the dog manages to work his way into his heart. Set against the picturesque Scottish countryside this film also stars Laurence Naismith and Kay Walsh and is a remake of “A Challenge to Lassie”.

results.title: Grey voyagers
results.creator_credit: Steve Westh, Stuart Menzies, Tony Wright and December Films
results.brief_description: A unique six part travel and adventure series featuring the remarkable stories of six ordinary ‘older people’ making extraordinary journeys to far flung parts of the globe.

results.title: Grey squirrel
results.brief_description: A study of the well-known grey squirrel: its habitat, its food, its habits during the four seasons, and how the young squirrel is taught to climb and to play.

results.title: Grey paddle power
results.creator_credit: Michael Loftus-Hills, LoftCom, Triple A Productions and Ivan Gaal
results.brief_description: This local documentary focuses on a group of elderly men and women who have embraced canoeing. Most train and belong to the suburban Fairfield Canoe Club where they thoroughly enjoy the recreation as well as the social aspect of the sport. Interviews reveal that the elderly members enjoy the physical benefits and challenges of competing, the camaraderie, and the chance to offer young people guidance.

results.title: Grey funnel line
results.creator_credit: Brian Voce, Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations and Vincent Donovan
results.brief_description: Records a 1974 goodwill cruise by a RAN task force to exotic locations in Africa. Shows sailors exploring tropical Mauritius, and ancient ruins of Persepolis, and observing wildlife in Kenya’s Tsavo National Park.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Voce, Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations and Vincent Donovan

results.title: Grendel, grendel, grendel
results.creator_credit: Victorian Film Corporation, Hoyts Theatres, TVW Enterprises, Phillip Adams and Alexander Stitt
results.brief_description: An intelligent, witty animation based on John Gardener’s popular novel which retells the Beowulf epic. Originally written in 600AD, the story pits Beowulf, a southern Swedish hero against a terrible monster, Grendel. In this adaptation, as with the novel, the legend is retold from Grendel’s viewpoint, making him a sympathetic, philosophic monster plagued by greedy, warring stupid creatures called men who invade his territory and his serenity. The characters are engaging and individual, coloured in pastels with a refreshing ambience. They are given voice by an eclectic range of performers including Keith Mitchell, Barry Hill and Bobby Bright. This is a highly engrossing story and is recommended for its humanist sympathies.

results.title: Gremlins
results.creator_credit: Amblin Entertainment, Warner Bros Pictures, Steven Spielberg, Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy, Michael Finnell and Joe Dante
results.brief_description: Billy Peltzer’s father buys him a new cuddly pet. But heed these three warnings: Don’t ever get him wet. Keep him away from bright light. And the most important thing, the one thing you must never forget: no matter how much he cries, no matter how much he begs…never, never feed him after midnight. Cast includes Zach Galligan, Phoebe Cates, Hoyt Axton, Polly Holliday, Frances Lee McCain.

results.title: Gregory Peck - His Own Man
results.brief_description: In Hollywood where many actors scramble for success - and are desperate to hold onto it - Gregory peck has taken chances. While he has become one of Hollywood’s most illustrious stars (49 movies in 39 years) Peck has always remained his own man. Rated: PG
